channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Lecture Video Visual Objects (LVVO) Dataset: A Benchmark for Visual Object Detection in Educational Videos
item.description: We introduce the Lecture Video Visual Objects (LVVO) dataset, a new benchmark for visual object detection in educational video content.

item.title: DETRPose: Real-time end-to-end transformer model for multi-person pose estimation
item.description: The paper presents a family of transformer-based models capable of performing multi-person 2D pose estimation in real-time.

item.title: Vine Copulas as Differentiable Computational Graphs
item.description: Vine copulas are sophisticated models for multivariate distributions and are increasingly used in machine learning.

item.title: Vector Ontologies as an LLM world view extraction method
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) possess intricate internal representations of the world, yet these latent structures are notoriously difficult to interpret or repurpose beyond the original prediction task.

item.title: TCANet: A Temporal Convolutional Attention Network for Motor Imagery EEG Decoding
item.description: This study proposes the Temporal Convolutional Attention Network (TCANet), a novel end-to-end model that hierarchically captures spatiotemporal dependencies by progressively integrating local, fused, and global features.

item.title: Focusing on Tracks for Online Multi-Object Tracking
item.description: Multi-object tracking (MOT) is a critical task in computer vision, requiring the accurate identification and continuous tracking of multiple objects across video frames.

item.title: Automated Risk Management Mechanisms in DeFi Lending Protocols: A Crosschain Comparative Analysis of Aave and Compound
item.description: In contrast, liquidations in v2 have an insignificant impact, which indicates that the most recent v3 protocols have better risk management than the earlier v2 protocols.

item.title: BeyondRPC: A Contrastive and Augmentation-Driven Framework for Robust Point Cloud Understanding
item.description: Robust perception of 3D point clouds remains a significant challenge in real-world environments where sensor data is often corrupted.

item.title: M^3-VOS: Multi-Phase, Multi-Transition, and Multi-Scenery Video Object Segmentation
item.description: In light of this, we introduce the concept of phase in segmentation, which categorizes real-world objects based on their visual characteristics and potential morphological and appearance changes.

item.title: MatchPlant: An Open-Source Pipeline for UAV-Based Single-Plant Detection and Data Extraction
item.description: Accurate identification of individual plants from unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) images is essential for advancing high-throughput phenotyping and supporting data-driven decision-making in plant breeding.

item.title: Real-Time Per-Garment Virtual Try-On with Temporal Consistency for Loose-Fitting Garments
item.description: This enhances the robustness of semantic map estimation under loose-fitting garments during garment-specific dataset generation.

item.title: Simple Radiology VLLM Test-time Scaling with Thought Graph Traversal
item.description: Test-time scaling offers a promising way to improve the reasoning performance of vision-language large models (VLLMs) without additional training.

item.title: Learning Encodings by Maximizing State Distinguishability: Variational Quantum Error Correction
item.description: Quantum error correction is crucial for protecting quantum information against decoherence.

item.title: Recursive KalmanNet: Deep Learning-Augmented Kalman Filtering for State Estimation with Consistent Uncertainty Quantification
item.description: State estimation in stochastic dynamical systems with noisy measurements is a challenge.

item.title: Vectorized Sparse Second-Order Forward Automatic Differentiation for Optimal Control Direct Methods
item.description: To achieve computational efficiency, these derivatives must be computed in sparse and vectorized form, exploiting the problem's inherent sparsity structure.

item.title: FAME: A Lightweight Spatio-Temporal Network for Model Attribution of Face-Swap Deepfakes
item.description: The widespread emergence of face-swap Deepfake videos poses growing risks to digital security, privacy, and media integrity, necessitating effective forensic tools for identifying the source of such manipulations.

item.title: FIMA-Q: Post-Training Quantization for Vision Transformers by Fisher Information Matrix Approximation
item.description: By following the block-wise reconstruction framework, we propose a novel PTQ method for ViTs, dubbed FIMA-Q.

item.title: Dual‑detector Re‑optimization for Federated Weakly Supervised Video Anomaly Detection Via Adaptive Dynamic Recursive Mapping
item.description: Federated weakly supervised video anomaly detection represents a significant advancement in privacy-preserving collaborative learning, enabling distributed clients to train anomaly detectors using only video-level annotations.

item.title: Efficient Speech Enhancement via Embeddings from Pre-trained Generative Audioencoders
item.description: Recent research has delved into speech enhancement (SE) approaches that leverage audio embeddings from pre-trained models, diverging from time-frequency masking or signal prediction techniques.

item.title: Code Execution as Grounded Supervision for LLM Reasoning
item.description: Training large language models (LLMs) with chain-of-thought (CoT) supervision has proven effective for enhancing their reasoning abilities.

item.title: GLAP: General contrastive audio-text pretraining across domains and languages
item.description: GLAP demonstrates its versatility by achieving competitive performance on standard audio-text retrieval benchmarks like Clotho and AudioCaps, while significantly surpassing existing methods in speech retrieval and classification tasks.

item.title: ReCUT: Balancing Reasoning Length and Accuracy in LLMs via Stepwise Trails and Preference Optimization
item.description: Recent advances in Chain-of-Thought (CoT) prompting have substantially improved the reasoning capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs).

item.title: CIIR@LiveRAG 2025: Optimizing Multi-Agent Retrieval Augmented Generation through Self-Training
item.description: This paper presents mRAG, a multi-agent retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) framework composed of specialized agents for subtasks such as planning, searching, reasoning, and coordination.

item.title: Accelerating Diffusion Large Language Models with SlowFast: The Three Golden Principles
item.description: Diffusion-based language models (dLLMs) have emerged as a promising alternative to traditional autoregressive LLMs by enabling parallel token generation and significantly reducing inference latency.

item.title: Enhancing Medical Dialogue Generation through Knowledge Refinement and Dynamic Prompt Adjustment
item.description: Medical dialogue systems (MDS) have emerged as crucial online platforms for enabling multi-turn, context-aware conversations with patients.

item.title: BioClinical ModernBERT: A State-of-the-Art Long-Context Encoder for Biomedical and Clinical NLP
item.description: Encoder-based transformer models are central to biomedical and clinical Natural Language Processing (NLP), as their bidirectional self-attention makes them well-suited for efficiently extracting structured information from unstructured text through discriminative tasks.

item.title: SDialog: A Python Toolkit for Synthetic Dialogue Generation and Analysis
item.description: The advancement of conversational AI systems relies on the availability of high-quality, flexible, and reproducible synthetic dialogues for training, evaluation, and benchmarking.

item.title: TableRAG: A Retrieval Augmented Generation Framework for Heterogeneous Document Reasoning
item.description: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) has demonstrated considerable effectiveness in open-domain question answering.

item.title: NeuralNexus at BEA 2025 Shared Task: Retrieval-Augmented Prompting for Mistake Identification in AI Tutors
item.description: This paper presents our system for Track 1: Mistake Identification in the BEA 2025 Shared Task on Pedagogical Ability Assessment of AI-powered Tutors.

item.title: Table-Text Alignment: Explaining Claim Verification Against Tables in Scientific Papers
item.description: Scientific claim verification against tables typically requires predicting whether a claim is supported or refuted given a table.

item.title: Beyond True or False: Retrieval-Augmented Hierarchical Analysis of Nuanced Claims
item.description: Moreover, these segments enable the discovery of varying perspectives towards an aspect of the claim (e. g., support, neutral, or oppose) and their respective prevalence (e. g., "how many biomedical papers believe vaccine A is more transportable than B?").

item.title: Towards Robust Multimodal Emotion Recognition under Missing Modalities and Distribution Shifts
item.description: To address these issues, we propose a novel robust MER framework, Causal Inference Distiller (CIDer), and introduce a new task, Random Modality Feature Missing (RMFM), to generalize the definition of modality missing.

item.title: Monitoring Decomposition Attacks in LLMs with Lightweight Sequential Monitors
item.description: We show that a carefully prompt engineered lightweight monitor achieves a 93% defense success rate, beating reasoning models like o3 mini as a monitor.

item.title: TaxoAdapt: Aligning LLM-Based Multidimensional Taxonomy Construction to Evolving Research Corpora
item.description: To address these gaps, we propose TaxoAdapt, a framework that dynamically adapts an LLM-generated taxonomy to a given corpus across multiple dimensions.

item.title: Principled Approaches for Extending Neural Architectures to Function Spaces for Operator Learning
item.description: A key factor in deep learning's success has been the careful engineering of neural architectures through extensive empirical testing.

item.title: ReconMOST: Multi-Layer Sea Temperature Reconstruction with Observations-Guided Diffusion
item.description: Specifically, we first pre-train an unconditional diffusion model using a large collection of historical numerical simulation data, enabling the model to attain physically consistent distribution patterns of ocean temperature fields.

item.title: Semantic-decoupled Spatial Partition Guided Point-supervised Oriented Object Detection
item.description: Recent remote sensing tech advancements drive imagery growth, making oriented object detection rapid development, yet hindered by labor-intensive annotation for high-density scenes.

item.title: Detecting Sockpuppetry on Wikipedia Using Meta-Learning
item.description: Malicious sockpuppet detection on Wikipedia is critical to preserving access to reliable information on the internet and preventing the spread of disinformation.

item.title: Decomposing MLP Activations into Interpretable Features via Semi-Nonnegative Matrix Factorization
item.description: A central goal for mechanistic interpretability has been to identify the right units of analysis in large language models (LLMs) that causally explain their outputs.

item.title: Execution Guided Line-by-Line Code Generation
item.description: We present a novel approach to neural code generation that incorporates real-time execution signals into the language model generation process.

item.title: MSTAR: Box-free Multi-query Scene Text Retrieval with Attention Recycling
item.description: Furthermore, we build the Multi-Query Text Retrieval (MQTR) dataset, the first benchmark designed to evaluate the multi-query scene text retrieval capability of models, comprising four query types and 16k images.

item.title: Time Series Forecasting as Reasoning: A Slow-Thinking Approach with Reinforced LLMs
item.description: Particularly, we design a fine-grained multi-objective reward specifically for time series forecasting, and then introduce GRIP (group-based relative importance for policy optimization), which leverages non-uniform sampling to further encourage and optimize the model's exploration of effective reasoning paths.

item.title: Hessian Geometry of Latent Space in Generative Models
item.description: Applied to diffusion models, the method reveals a fractal structure of phase transitions in the latent space, characterized by abrupt changes in the Fisher metric.

item.title: Learning-Based Stable Optimal Control for Infinite-Time Nonlinear Regulation Problems
item.description: This paper proposes a learning-based framework to learn a stable optimal controller for nonlinear optimal regulation problems.

item.title: Farseer: A Refined Scaling Law in Large Language Models
item.description: Training Large Language Models (LLMs) is prohibitively expensive, creating a critical scaling gap where insights from small-scale experiments often fail to transfer to resource-intensive production systems, thereby hindering efficient innovation.

item.title: Saturation Self-Organizing Map
item.description: Continual learning poses a fundamental challenge for neural systems, which often suffer from catastrophic forgetting when exposed to sequential tasks.

item.title: A Study on Individual Spatiotemporal Activity Generation Method Using MCP-Enhanced Chain-of-Thought Large Language Models
item.description: This work contributes to integrating CoT reasoning with MCP for urban behavior modeling, advancing LLMs applications in urban computing and providing a practical approach for synthetic mobility data generation.

item.title: Efficiency Robustness of Dynamic Deep Learning Systems
item.description: Deep Learning Systems (DLSs) are increasingly deployed in real-time applications, including those in resourceconstrained environments such as mobile and IoT devices.

item.title: Viability of Future Actions: Robust Safety in Reinforcement Learning via Entropy Regularization
item.description: Despite the many recent advances in reinforcement learning (RL), the question of learning policies that robustly satisfy state constraints under unknown disturbances remains open.

item.title: Lattice Climber Attack: Adversarial attacks for randomized mixtures of classifiers
item.description: However, existing attacks have been shown to not suit this kind of classifier.
